channel.title: The Old Black Mesa Site
channel.description:
For those of you who are interested, I've entered the Black Mesa domain into the Wayback Machine and it came up with quite a few results. This is for those didn't get a chance to see the old website and also for those who miss it.
CAUTION: Some of the links in these archives will not work.
[url='https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://blackmesasource.com']https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://blackmesasource.com[/url]
I found this quite interesting. :slight_smile:

item.title: The Old Black Mesa Site
item.dc:creator: Dunedain
item.description:
If there’s any lingering doubt as to the status of the song I referred to in my previous posts (that played automatically when you visited the original site’s home page), check the url below, first song, link even still works.

https://web.archive.org/web/20071028183144/www.blackmesasource.com/downloads.html

Read full topic

item.title: The Old Black Mesa Site
item.dc:creator: GordonReturns
item.description:
Ah…old memories. The HTML site always being “down for maintenance” always made me come back to see if it was ever up. Also brings back fun times when I wandered the Suggestions Forum a lot and flamed people :’)

Read full topic

item.title: The Old Black Mesa Site
item.dc:creator: jerry
item.description:
Yes, i thought it fitted perfectly with Black Mesa. I don’t care that flash is not cool, it still looked the best back then :3

EDIT:

CatzEyes93:

I am an idiot. I meant to post this: Leafy
It is the basis of my existing site.

Thanks for showing me the wrong page. I was looking for printable versions of the covers
And, that template looks great ;D

item.description:

But this is all off topic. We should probably get back to discussing how kewl the old BM website was.

It got messy. (plus people complained bout the flash. ) So I took out the banner.

item.title: The Old Black Mesa Site
item.dc:creator: Dunedain
item.description:
I was under the impression it was the main Black Mesa theme song. Like when you buy a game, say, S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl (great game, by the way ), usually there will be a main title song that always plays when the game starts at the main game menu, and maybe at some important points in the game it will play, as well.

This is often referred to as the main theme song of the game. It is the single song that most represents what the game is; it sets the tone, the feel, the atmosphere of what the game is about, it’s setting, the story, the characters, and so on.

Read full topic

item.title: The Old Black Mesa Site
item.dc:creator: Ballsopt
item.description:
I’m still not sure how it’s a “theme.”

theme for what, exactly…the promotional campaign? the main menu? the Inbound sequence?

Read full topic

item.title: The Old Black Mesa Site
item.dc:creator: Dunedain
item.description:
So nice to see the original site still up. Love how the Black Mesa theme song plays as soon as the site opens. That is one of the nicest and most fitting pieces of music I’ve ever heard in any game (from id, Valve, you name it), it’s just perfect for Black Mesa. I’m almost looking forward to hearing all the music in Black Mesa as much I am to playing the game itself.

You fellows ought to put that music back in the main page of the new site, so it plays when the page opens. It’s a great way to be greeted to the site.

Read full topic

item.title: The Old Black Mesa Site
item.dc:creator: Otto
item.description:
stevem65804:

I remember that site. Damn; 2006?!

Not only that, but 2005!

Where does the time go?

I most sincerely agree.

[COLOR=‘Gray’]Most sincerely.[/SIZE]

Read full topic

item.title: The Old Black Mesa Site
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
I could give a dam about HTML5. I just want to be able to use CSS2/3 and have it work on every browser.

A man can dream…

@Dillxn If it wasn’t for the fact whey were paying me, I think I would just punch some of my clients in the face.

@Catz I do use small bits of flash on my pages, but only in a manner that is 95%-100% unobtrusive. I follow these rules when using flash.

  • The purpose of the flash is to add a small feature to the site that the user can navigate without any hindrance even if flash is not installed.
  • Do not prompt the user to install flash player if it is not installed.
  • Restore at-least partial functionality to users who don’t have flash player.

Read full topic
